page.title: 03DRAYCOTT STRAWBERRIES
page.content: {DRAYCOTT}HAS FERTILE SOIL, FACES SOUTH,AND IS PROTECTED BY THE {MENDIP {HILLS}BECAUSE OF THIS IT IS AN EXCELLENT PLACE FOR {STRAWBERRY {GROWING.}MANY PEOPLE IN DRAYCOTT WORK IN THE STRAWBERRY FIELDS WORKING VERY LONG HOURS FROM MARCH TO SEPTEMBER. DRAYCOTT'S SHELTERED POSITION MAKES IT ABOUT A MONTH AHEAD IN FRUIT PRODUCTION FROM THE REST OF ITS BRITISH RIVALS; THE MAIN PICKING TIME IS BETWEEN THE MIDDLE OF {MAY} AND THE END OF{JUNE.}AS THE WORK IS SEASONAL MANY OF THE PICKERS ARE 'TRAVELLERS' WHO GO FROM ONE HARVEST TO ANOTHER AROUND THE COUNTRY. THE STRAWBERRY GROWER USES A SMALL AREA OF LAND, ABOUT 4 ACRES, BUT AT THE HEIGHT OF THE SEASON THIS LAND CAN PRODUCE A TON OF STRAWBERRIES A DAY. .
